column1: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba!////We decided to split some of their tapas dishes
column2: which I highly recommend doing when you visit. The spicy potatoes with tomato aioli were just the right amount of crispiness.  The spice level of the potatoes was manageable
column3: but I do like spicy foods.  We each ordered our own beef empanada
column4: and this was a solid choice.  The pastry crust of the empanada was just the right amount of flakey
column5: and the filling was well seasoned.  My favorite tapas dish we ordered was the buttermilk fried chicken thighs with piri piri sauce.  The chicken and sauce paired beautifully together for a delicious flavor.  Cafe Ba Ba Reeba has a fun
column6: lively atmosphere and I highly recommend checking it out.
